thread.title: FAKE: Dem Senator Tries to Create Fake News… 1 Humiliating Fact Stops Him
thread.title_full: FAKE: Dem Senator Tries to Create Fake News… 1 Humiliating Fact Stops Him

author: Ben Marquis
title: FAKE: Dem Senator Tries to Create Fake News… 1 Humiliating Fact Stops Him
text:
WATCH: Camera Captures Moment Melania Cries During Pre-Inauguration Worship Service 
Even the reliably liberal “fact-checking” website Snopes was incapable of corroborating the supposed Franklin quote, which has been passed around since the mid-2000s, ultimately labeling it “unproven” as of May 2016. 
When the DCNF reached out to Booker’s office for comment on the false quote, it received only a sarcastic reply from his communications director, Jeff Giertz, who simply said: “As Ben Franklin may or may not have said, ‘to err is human; to forgive, divine.’” 
Correcting errors is important, however, too. As of about 2 p.m. Wednesday, both quotes were live on Booker’s Facebook and Twitter accounts. 
We wonder when Booker will “forgive” Trump for his alleged transgressions and return to being the bipartisan golden-boy and future hope for the Democrat Party, because as of right now, he is veering ever-so sharply to the left, and is poised to go off the rails into the morass of progressivism that was just soundly rejected by the American voters in most of the country. 
Just as a reminder to everyone — it is wise to double-check and verify the things you share on social media before you actually post it, lest you end up guilty of spreading “fake news” or false quotes as well. 
Please share this on Facebook and Twitter to let everyone know that Cory Booker is spreading a fake quote attributed to Benjamin Franklin. What do you think of Sen. Cory Booker sharing a false quote on his social media pages? Scroll down to comment below! Advertisement Popular Right Now
